moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6
comment: Quietly, Black has transferred his cavalry to the kingside.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7
comment: Now White has the advantage of the Bishop pair.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7 14. Ne5
comment:
Steinitz, for now
has nothing in view. He has placed his Knight in e5 ... just to bother his
opponent which is now to act in a resctricted space.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7 14. Ne5 Rd8 15. Qe2 b6 16. b4 Bb7 17. f4 Nf5 18. Qf2 c5
comment: Black decides to sacrifice a pawn to enlarge his horizon.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7 14. Ne5 Rd8 15. comment:
Steinitz sacrifices a
piece to get total control on the open "d" file and a possible pawn mass on
the kingside.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7 14. Ne5 Rd8 15. comment:
It is true that Steinitz is a piece down but his
aggressive position (the black Rooks, for now, look paralized) makes think
that he has more than enough compensation. Is it true? 29...

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. e3 Nd7 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. e4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Ndf6 9. Bd3 Qa5 10. Bd2 Ne7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 Bxc3 13. Bxc3 Qc7 14. Ne5 Rd8 15. comment:
! - At a better look the white Rooks too are now almost paralized. The Rook in
d1 cannot go up (because of Ra8-a1+) and cannot move horizontally.
